title: Citi Foundation Supports Young Entrepreneurs Program in Costa Rica
summary: San Jose, Costa Rica – Citi Foundation and Junior Achievement (JA) Costa Rica launched a program that encourages entrepreneurship among Costa Rican youth. The Youth Entrepreneurship Workshops, a JA program, is one of the most successful economic education programs of JA worldwide. Citi Costa Rica executives volunteered their time to train 15 microenterprises founded by students from eight schools nationwide. This program demonstrates Citi's commitment to financial education, the development of the country and JA Costa Rica.
tag-1: Citi Foundation Supports Young Entrepreneurs Program in Costa Rica
tag-3: San Jose, Costa Rica – Citi Foundation and Junior Achievement (JA) Costa Rica launched a program that encourages entrepreneurship among Costa Rican youth. The Youth Entrepreneurship Workshops, a JA program, is one of the most successful economic education programs of JA worldwide. Citi Costa Rica executives volunteered their time to train 15 microenterprises founded by students from eight schools nationwide. This program demonstrates Citi's commitment to financial education, the development of the country and JA Costa Rica.
tag-4: The microenterprises will host a product launching event, September 27 at Cinepolis Terramall room #6 between 8:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m., in front of a jury, which includes Citi Costa Rica executives. More than 600 students will participate in this activity together with their schoolteachers and JA Costa Rica members.
tag-5: "It is important for us to train young people for the real world they will face after completing high school," said Cristina Alfaro, Legal Head, Citi Costa Rica and a member of the bank's Social Investment Committee. "We want to provide them with the necessary skills to succeed and to develop an entrepreneurship vision from the start. It is our responsibility to do so, and we are deeply committed to our principle of performing responsible finance in all countries where we do business."
tag-6: The Youth Entrepreneurship Workshops make up an educational program where high-school students create and manage their own existent and productive small businesses. For 15 weeks, they learn about business processes, guided by consultants from the marketing, production and finance sectors. Using the JA programs, the workshops support the creation and strengthening of a culture of social responsibility and entrepreneurship.

tag-9: Citi Foundation  The Citi Foundation is committed to the economic empowerment and financial inclusion of individuals and families, particularly those in need, in the communities where we work so that they can improve their standard of living. Globally, the Citi Foundation targets its strategic giving to priority focus areas: Microfinance and Microbusinesses, Small Businesses, Education, Financial Education and Asset Building. The Citi Foundation works with its partners in Microfinance and Microbusinesses, as well as in Small Businesses, to support environmental programs and innovations. Additional information can be found at www.citifoundation.com
tag-10: Junior Achievement Since 1988, Junior Achievement is dedicated to implementing outreach educational programs at public and private schools nationwide. Their programs partner with businesses and professionals to share their expertise with children and young people showing them the way to follow to have success as individuals and to contribute to the success of our society, taking entrepreneurship as an engine of social and economic development. To date, about 100,000 children and young people have been benefited. www.ja.org
